item.title: Sonya add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "I felt, that night, on that stage, under that skull, incredibly close to everything in the universe, but also extremely alone. I wondered, for the first time in my life, if life was worth all the work it took to live. What exactly made it worth it? What's so horrible about being dead forever, and not feeling anything, and not even dreaming? What's so great about feeling and dreaming?" -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Sonya add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "You cannot protect yourself from sadness without protecting yourself from happiness." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Sonya add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "It's the tragedy of loving, you can't love anything more than something you miss." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Sonya add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "There were things I wanted to tell him. But I knew they would hurt him. So I buried them, and let them hurt me." -- Jonathan Safran Foer
